posts.name: Ryan Radtke
posts.cooked: im trying to update my code with the 2027 release for system core but whenever i attempt to do anything in robotpy (ex: init sync) it just gives me this error. Traceback (most recent call last): File “/home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/robotpy/main.py”, line 245, in main cmd_class = entry_point.load() File “/usr/lib/python3.13/importlib/metadata/ init .py”, line 179, in load module = import_module(match.group(‘module’)) File “/usr/lib/python3.13/importlib/ init .py”, line 88, in import_module return _bootstrap._gcd_import(name[level:], package, level) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ File “”, line 1387, in _gcd_import File “”, line 1360, in _find_and_load File “”, line 1331, in _find_and_load_unlocked File “”, line 935, in _load_unlocked File “”, line 1026, in exec_module File “”, line 488, in _call_with_frames_removed File “/home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/pyfrc/mains/cli_sim.py”, line 9, in import wpilib File “/home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/wpilib/ init .py”, line 1, in from . import _init__wpilib File “/home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/wpilib/_init__wpilib.py”, line 4, in import native.wpilib._init_robotpy_native_wpilib File “/home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/native/wpilib/_init_robotpy_native_wpilib.py”, line 4, in import native.wpiutil._init_robotpy_native_wpiutil File “/home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/native/wpiutil/_init_robotpy_native_wpiutil.py”, line 19, in __lib = __load_library() File “/home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/native/wpiutil/_init_robotpy_native_wpiutil.py”, line 13, in __load_library return cdll.LoadLibrary(lib_path) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^ File “/usr/lib/python3.13/ctypes/ init .py”, line 471, in LoadLibrary return self._dlltype(name) ~~~~~~~~~~~~~^^^^^^ File “/usr/lib/python3.13/ctypes/ init .py”, line 390, in init self._handle = _dlopen(self._name, mode) ~~~~~~~^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^^ OSError: /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6: version `GLIBC_2.38’ not found (required by /home/ryan/Desktop/swerve template/venv/lib/python3.13/site-packages/native/wpiutil/lib/libwpiutil.so) Plugin error detected in ‘EntryPoint(name=‘sim’, value=‘pyfrc.mains.cli_sim:PyFrcSim’, group=‘robotpy’)’ (use --ignore-plugin-errors to ignore this) Is there anyway to fix it cause i feel like updating it will just lead to something else. Im on pop os btw

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: Your version of glibc is too old. You need to upgrade your OS. Minimum supported for wpilib is 24.04 I believe.

posts.name: Ryan Radtke
posts.cooked: So i have to change my distro cause pop os only goes up to 22.04. is there any other way that you can think of. if not i get it

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked:
glibc is fundamental to the OS. In theory there are hacks you can do to use a different version, but I probably wouldn’t recommend it.

You could run things inside a 24.04 docker container, and that should work fine. You just wouldn’t be able to run the simulation UI without a bunch of work because it requires OpenGL.

posts.name: Ryan Radtke
posts.cooked: i updated to the alpha version of pop os and it seems to be working thx. do you know why it needs to be 24.04 cause the 25 release worked perfectly fine with 22.04. if not all good im just curious.

posts.name: Dustin Spicuzza
posts.cooked: The wpilib team likes to upgrade compilers so they can use newer C++ features, which requires upgrading the OS.

posts.name: Davo
posts.cooked:
Additionally to this point, the general stance of the WPILib team is that only operating systems that are not end-of-life for the entirety of the season will be supported for a given WPILib release. This is also our stance for choosing what Python versions we support.

Per Ubuntu | endoflife.date , Ubuntu 22.04 will no longer receive public security updates from April 2027 onwards, which would be squarely in the middle of the FRC 2027 competition season.

posts.name: Peter Johnson
posts.cooked: We are changing this to be move more quickly in 2027+.  WPILib will support only the most recent Debian stable version (or the Ubuntu LTS based on it).  This means for the 2027 and 2028 seasons, we will build targeting Debian Trixie (released in Aug 2025) which will correspond to Ubuntu 26.04 LTS.  We will then bump to Debian Forky / Ubuntu 28.04 for the 2029/30 seasons, etc.
